content: - highlight the messages - rightclick and select 'save as' to desired folder
creator: davidsk

content: Filters specify what to do, not what to not do. I presume this is a POP account.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi, I created an email contact address book only on thunderbird. I changed PC in the meantime. How can I copy or transfer the contact address book from the old PC to the new PC? - Thank you, Gianfranco.

Export the address book on the old computer in LDIF format. Then import the LDIF file on the new computer.
creator: christ1

content: Na tom posledním obrázku vidím localhost. Tam se určitě nemůžeš přihlašovat, takže máš asi zadané nesprávné údaje. Návod: Nová e-mailová adresa

content:
The message counters in the status bar are gone. That's not a bug, it's been a deliberate change in TB115. Whether this has been a good idea is debatable.

The counter for selected messages now lives in the Message List Header. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/getting-started-thunderbird-main-window-supernova

Alternatively you may want to take a look at Betterbird. The message counters in the status bar have been restored there. https://betterbird.eu/
creator: christ1

content: Enable View/Layout/Message List Header to show the number selected.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Thank you for the guidance.

Yes let me say emphatically that the new position for the message counters is a BAD IDEA. Now I have to waste vertical space to see the counter. What was wrong with its logical position in the status bar? The status bar has plenty of available space and is something most people will want to have showing, so why now move the counter to another bar that you have to enable? Where do I submit my vote saying it "ain't broke don't fix it" and mess it up - let's put the message counter back to where it was.
creator: eberger5

content:
By the way, one other issue. When I get a message in TBird saying someone responded to my post I can click "Mark is as solved" or "Doesn't solve my problem." If I click mark it solved, I would think it would take me to the support page to look at the message threads and perhaps add a comment. Instead it takes me to a blank white screen. It has worked that way for quite some time now.

The way to get back to the threads is to click "doesn't solve my problem." Is that the way it is meant to work?
creator: eberger5

content: You can voice your concerns at connect.mozilla.org and submit in the IDEAS section. I have posted several comments there. Whether anything happens, I don't know, but I felt better for having documented my issue.
creator: davidsk

content:
... let's put the message counter back to where it was.

For Thunderbird, this ship has sailed. If you want those counters in the status bar Betterbird is your best bet.
creator: christ1

content: Did realize Betteerbird existed. Very interesting. I think for now I will stay with TBird. Hopefully it will catch up. I like the Mozilla community.
creator: eberger5

content:
Oh, I notice I did get an email from Microsoft advising me that thunderbird now has access to the Microsoft account with that very email address. This is on the Windows 11 laptop that I set up for Oauth2 last night. And yeah, it does have access and works.

This all worked swell on that machine, the others, not so much.
creator: steve.waechter

content:
If you had to enter the address manually in the OAuth window, it's probably because cookies aren't accepted. Cookies must be accepted in TB Settings, at least for the MS authorization site, for the OAuth process to complete.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1417298#answer-1588949
creator: sfhowes
